Reviews.Title: “The Djem is real Gem”
Reviews.Author: David47K
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights at this wonderful hotel. It is centrally located on a quiet street right off the hippodrome. The room was spacious, clean and tastefully decorated. Breakfast was included and had a nice variety of breads, cheeses, sweets, cereal and fruit.The hotel is right next to the Blue Mosque so the morning call to prayer was rather loud but we thought it added to the overall experience. But the nicest thing about the hotel was the very friendly and helpful owner and staff. His advice for restaurants could not have been better and lead us to some superb places that were off the beaten track. We highly recommend a stay here if you find yourself in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing find in Istanbuil”
Reviews.Author: peri w
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed two nights at Hotel Djem in May 2011. The remodeled old house used to be an art gallery and several unique pieces decorated the walls of Hotel Djem. Walking in was a visual delight, with lush colours and a very warm vibe. Our room was the blue walled doubled that overlooked the street. The room albeit small was extremely cozy. I especially liked the art placed above the toilet in the bathroom- everything was so artistically put together. The beds were gorgeous to sleep in- almost made us feel like staying in the whole day. A short walk to the city centre but everything is a short walk in Istanbul- all the great sights seem to be located in the same areas. The host was very attentive and accomodating. One place I recommend to check out is the Rustem Pacha Mosque, a quaint and peaceful mosque tucked away in the city heights that we came about through pure accident- but was one of my favorite experiences in Istanbul. Enjoy Hotel Djem, I miss it so!

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to stay in Sultanahmed”
Reviews.Author: wroclawianka
Reviews.Content: Our 4 nights stay last September at the Hotel Dejm was excellent. The hotel is small and charming yet provided first class service. Every day we had yummy, fresh breakfast with hot tea and sweets during day. Mr. Faruk Tekin (the owner) and his team were great and did everything to make us feel at home. After first night of sleeping on a pretty hard mattress, I have asked Mr. Faruk if they have any rooms with softer bed because of my back problems. We even didnâ€™t finish our breakfast when the hotel stuff brought to our room an extra thick but soft mattress pad. I am so thankful to them for this special treatment. The hotel is beautifully decorated with the artwork of the owners, who also sell their artwork at two nearby shops. At the end of the trip we have purchased one of the art made by Mr. Farukâ€™s brother, which we really enjoy. The location was perfect. The hotel was on a small back street, very close, just a wall behind to the Blue Mosque. In fact, every morning at dawn, if you donâ€™t sleep too soundly, you can hear a call to prayer, which I loved to listen to. Other old city attractions, like: Hippodrome, Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Palace, Archeological Museum, Yerabatan/Basilica Cistern, Grand Bazaar, and Spice Bazaar, are in a walking distance. A block away from the hotel was small bazaar. The merchandise in the bazaar was similar to the one at the Grand Bazaar. In most shops the prices were as marked, so the game of negotiating prices was not necessary. Certainly I'll recommend this wonderful place and stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A hideaway in the maze of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: STLL7
Reviews.Content: Tucked away from the hustle and bustle of the main visitor's attractions of Istanbul, Hotel Djem gives a peaceful escape at the end of the day. Beautifully remodeled old houses in one of the best quarters of Istanbul, Sultanahmet, within close walking distance to the Archeological Museum (a full day visit), the Grand Bazar and Egiptian (Spice) Market, The Hippodrome, The Cistern, Aya Sophia, The Blue Mosk, the train station. Great green curvy streets, warm and hospitable front desk. The owner was very kind to answer our questions at breakfast time and send us to the right places for what we were looking for in our inevitable quest for local food and crafts.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we've found in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: DobberBird
Reviews.Content: We've made several trips to Istanbul and have ended up at a different hotel every time: each one has had something in its favour and something that could have been better. At Djem, however, we finally found our ideal Istanbul hotel. First: location. The hotel is literally right next to the Blue Mosque. Steer clear if you don't want the call to prayer first thing in the morning but if, like us, you think it's all part of the atmosphere of Istanbul, then this couldn't be closer. The hotel is in two separate buildings - we stayed in the annexe (?) which is very close - 30 seconds walk - to the main hotel. The buildings are lovely - atmospheric yet very warm and welcoming. The room had bags of character and was really quiet and comfortable. We got a fantastic welcome: friendly, hospitable, and not at all pushy. The coffee on arrival was really appreciated after a long day of travel. Breakfast was plentiful and varied. We were sad to be staying only one night and will definitely return to the hotel on our future trips to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: paula_a_d
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed a one week stay with my family in one of the apart suites. Beautiful hotel, very clean, great location. Breakfast included, with a good variety. Really nice and helpful staff. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “A stay that excelled our expectations”
Reviews.Author: Monca77
Reviews.Content: We went to Istanbul to spend the New Year there and we couldnÂ´t have chosen a better hotel. The service was excellent, particularly Simon, the receptionist, was really nice and kind, showed us everything we needed and gave us some useful tips. The room was small but nice, you donÂ´t need too much space if the only time you spend in the room is for sleeping afterall. Perfect location, just next to the Blue mosque, and even though the muezzin sings early in the morning, we didnÂ´t care much. What woke me up though was a strange way of ringing from a nearby school that started at about 6:30. But wasnÂ´t a big inconvenience neither. The breakfast was good but could vary a bit after few days. The second day we discovered that it is possible to have some eggs though. Overall excellent stay, but if you decide to go to Istanbul, bear in mind that 4 days is definitely not enough.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in Hotel Djem”
Reviews.Author: painter012
Reviews.Content: Hotel Djem is a delight. It is in a fantastic location, on a very quiet street, with an owner/manager who is accommodating, knowledgeable, kind, and resourseful. His staff are some of the best. The rooms are clean and modern with modern en suite bathrooms and beautiful Turkish art displayed throughout. The breakfast has to be one of the best in Istanbul! Stay there...you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Djem really is a little gem!”
Reviews.Author: vg2288
Reviews.Content: What a great little hotel. Small and private just near the Hippodrome and behind the Blue Mosque. Faruk and his staff are extremely knowledgable about the history of the city and willing to spend time with their guests advising great places to see and things to do and always with the kind offer of the traditional cup of tea at any time of the day or night. The rooms were a very good size (we had 2 rooms) and absolutely spotless. The photos on the website were exactly what we got, tasteful and welcoming, just what you would expect in a boutique hotel. A short stroll to most of the major attractions and restaurants in Istanbul and close to the tram which takes you to the boat harbour and bus terminal. Fantastic public transport which was very inexpensive and a great way to see this fascinating city. Everything is so close you can visit several places in the same day. We stayed for 5 nights in one of the apartments and then returned for one night in the hotel and just loved it. Breakfast was always fresh and plentiful. Hotel Djem was one of the best finds on our travels - it exceeded our expectations and we really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Djem is a true gem”
Reviews.Author: CROC53
Reviews.Content: It is a delightful small boutique hotel in the old city Reasonably priced and has its own unique serenity as it was originally an art gallery Mr Faruk Tekin (GM) was extremly helpful providing genuine advice and we thoroughly enjoyed his recommendations that added to the highlights of our trip We would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique hotel, very central and homely.”
Reviews.Author: RichTiss
Reviews.Content: Farouk the owner manager was extremely helpful, he planned our daily trip including where to eat. Should have also been a tour guide. The staff could not have been more helpful, Sahin was outstanding. It was very clean, quiet and the internet connection was great. We will stay there again. The laundry service was reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “All that we hoped for”
Reviews.Author: PanagiotisG13
Reviews.Content: Probably one of the best hotels you can stay in istanbul. The location is perfect.Next to the blue mosque and 5 min walk from ayia sofia and the tram station. I believe it s the best location.It s in the middle of everything but it s also quiet. The room was great.Spacious and very clean.The bathroom was as well spacious and very clean. The breakfast was excellent like everything. Many options to get you started for a busy day sightseeing! Last but not least the staff were AMAZING and really helpfull with everything. There s always someone at the reception that can help you with anything you might want. Any info you might also want don t hesitate to ask. Would surely go back there for my next visit in istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “A haven of style, comfort and hospitality in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: travelbug61
Reviews.Content: My 5-night stay at the Djem couldn't have been more delightful. The small (11-room) hotel in the heart of Sultanahmet, right behind the Blue Mosque and the Hippodrome, has been renovated to include all the modern comforts and is beautifully decorated with Turkish textiles and kilims. I requested, and received, room #10 in the annex (only a few doors down from the main hotel), which has a up-close view of the Blue Mosque. (The call to prayer from the Blue Mosque could be heard loud and clear from this room, so sleeping with earplugs is a good idea.) My room was sparkling clean, and so beautiful and comfortable, that I loved spending spare time relaxing in it. The bathroom was spacious and spotless, and everything functioned really well. Housekeeping standards were consistently high. The buffet breakfast, served in a nicely decorated area in the main lobby, was by far the best I had during my travels in Turkey. Excellent brewed coffee, lots of fresh juices, perfectly ripe fruits (melons, figs, plums, clementines, pomegranates), vegetables, breads, pastries, cheeses, cold cuts, eggs cooked to order, and marvelous Turkish yogurt (esp. delicious mixed with pine honey and pomegranate seeds). As nice as the amenities are, what I appreciated most about the Djem was the genuine hospitality of Farouk, the owner, and his staff. Nothing was too much trouble for them; every question, every request, was handled not only with efficiency but also with grace and kindness. If I have a chance to visit Istanbul again, I would love to return to the Djem.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Capeberg
Reviews.Content: My sister and I recently stayed at Hotel Djem and were very happy we stayed there. The location is great, owner and staff are very friendly and go out of their way to help you and assist with where to go. It is quiet and peaceful, breakfasts are great especially the different breads and pastries. Much nicer than a big impersonal hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice cozy hotel in the byzantine heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: nadia-ath
Reviews.Content: Beautiful little boutique hotel just behind the blue mosque. The hotel staff has been excellent, helpful in any sense, our room very beautiful. I would definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “The Djem is a Gem!”
Reviews.Author: GreatDaysInParis
Reviews.Content: I just spent six nights at the Djem with several clients for my Turkish culinary/cultural tour. The hotel is an excellent choice for its location, the level of comfort and lovely decor for a very fair price and, perhaps most of all, its staff. Farouk, the owner-manager is hands-on in the best sense. The staff is welcoming and very helpful for questions and details large and small. I was concerned that the location right behind the Blue Mosque might be extremely noisy during the call to prayer. It was not a problem at all. The breakfast buffet was very good with a terrific selection of fresh fruit (melon and figs in the early fall!) and excellent filter coffee. The hotel and the rooms are decorated with beautiful kilims and textiles. This is a family that has a long history in the textile business and the DJEM shops in the Arasta Bazaar and in Sultanahmet have beautiful kilim bags of superb quality and lots of other beautiful temptations, I highly recommend this hotel. And they also have three short stay apartments a few minutes away that are an excellent option for families.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel and staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: ramblegal
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my husband for several nights last May - had a huge, elegant room in the building down the street. We were welcomed with tea and cookies, and wandered off to stumble into all of the sights. Breakfast was a wonderful buffet, and staff were great. Navigated all over the city easily, by foot, tram, and ferry. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer care - a really good hotel”
Reviews.Author: 4Danny
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review as we are just leaving the hotel. The location is perfect for a 3-4 days visit of the city. Since the hotel only has a dozen rooms or so, the manager personally takes care of all the guests, with a piece of advice for everyone, restaurant recommendations and other useful information. The breakfast is very good, you can have the cook make you fresh omlette or fried eggs, there are plenty of fruits and delicious pastry, turkish coffee and tea. The hotel is furnished in traditional turkish style, very cosy and original.

Reviews.Title: “Great room but service below what we had experienced elsewhere in Turkey”
Reviews.Author: lotsoftravels
Reviews.Content: When we arrived late at night to reception we were ordered by a man working at the hotel to hand over our passports and to get back into the car. Once he had taken photocopies of our passports we were driven in the car to our hotel room which was a few streets away. This would have been fine except with the winding streets in Sultanahmet we could not easily find reception again. The man dropped us off, with the keys, and that is the last time anyone from the hotel ever spoke to us. We did not get any recommendations, any help booking tours or transfers, or even any tea as mentioned by other reviewers. In any other country this would be no problem but we had experienced such generous hospitality from other hotels during our trip in Turkey that we were a bit disappointed. The positives however were that the room was large and clean, and in a great location for visting all the major sites. Someone came and cleaned our room daily. We even had a kitchen (however the lack of supermarkets around meant we wouldn't have cooked even if we wanted to). Despite the nice room we still felt the quite significant room rate was not justified given how cheap accommodation is in Turkey. Furthermore I recommend you dont let the hotel book you an airport transfer as they charge far more than elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly nice hotel with a very professional staff”
Reviews.Author: farhad H
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, together with our two young kids stayed at hotel Djem for 5 days in August. It was the best thing we found out about Istanbul! Very neat, comfortable and professionally managed. Yet, the best thing we found out about Djem was its historic neighborhood, and its proximity to the best spot in Istanbul, the historic blue mosque area (in addition, it was the month of Ramadan, so we enjoyed evening outdoor ceremonies and night festivals every day) It was just awesome! Farouq, the hotel manager, is extremely helpful and can guide you to anything you want to know or see Istanbul. He made this little hotel into a piece of art..

Reviews.Title: “A haven in old Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: sol-soprano
Reviews.Content: My party of three stayed at Hotel Djem for three nights in early September. We were collected from Ataturk airport in a mini bus and taken to the hotel. My first impression of Istanbul was of a bright, sprawling modern metropolis. We then turned off the main carriageway into the Sultanahmet area where Hotel Djem is situated and were immediately transported into a different world. Hotel Djem is situated in the old town and accessed via fairly narrow cobbled streets with a few shops and a restaurant in the immediate area. The area was clean and had modern amenities but it was echoes of the past that bid us welcome. The hotel looked just like it did online. On arrival we were greeted by Farouk who provided us with Turkish tea and pastries whilst he dealt with the paperwork. The seating was comfortable and everything was clean and tastefully decorated which made us feel relaxed and happy to be there. The hotel is divided into two separate buildings and our room was in the second building about forty metres from the main building and reception. The foyer of this building again was beautiful with large sofas, beautiful rugs and other furnishings that caught the eye. We stayed in room nine which was on the first floor and it was lovely and again, just like the photos online. The room was large, beautifully decorated and had a storage table big enough for three suitcases which stopped them cluttering up the room. There was a large wardrobe and dressing table and a safe for added security. The bathroom was spacious and well stocked with good quality toiletries and towels.Slippers were provided and the beds were comfortable and spacious (I had a large single bed) with good quality linens. There was also a television, a fridge and a good air con system. The 24 hour concierge was also a positive and the internet worked well. Farouk was also kind enough to print certain itineraries when we needed them. The location of Hotel Djem was also a plus. The street was not overly busy during the day and was quiet at night. The old Hippodrome and the Blue Mosque were about a one minute walk away. The Hagia Sofia was about five minutes away and the Grand Bazaar was about ten minutes away. There is also a tramway stop about six minutes away so the location is well serviced in terms of transport and points of interest. Service at Hotel Djem was first class. The breakfasts were lovely and there was a a wide variety from fruit to eggs to local pastries and cut meats and cheese. The butter and the preserves complimented the pastries and a tasty start to the day was rounded off with a nice cup of coffee. Farouk was always on hand to make suggestions as to where to go and how to get there. All our questions were answered in sufficient detail which made our sightseeing run smoothly. Shahin also helped us get front row seats to watch the whirling dervish and also arranged for a car to chauffeur us from the hotel (and back) to one of the delightful fish restaurants nearby-a very enjoyable experience well worth sampling. Shahin was also so helpful when one of my party felt unwell. On the morning of our departure, we were due to be collected early. An alarm call was offered and received and a special breakfast was laid on for us as we were departing before the scheduled one. I really hope to return to Istanbul again and staying at Hotel Djem created the perfect first impression of not only of Istanbul but of Turkey too.TIP-a lot of the rooms can be viewed online and when booking it is possible to find out which room(s) you will be allocated. I would not hesitate to stay at Hotel Djem again. The whole experience was first class.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in the magical old town”
Reviews.Author: Mayothamayo
Reviews.Content: My group and I stayed at Hotel Djem from 8th September for 3 nights in a triple room. We were picked up at the airport (complimentary, as we were paying cash) and as we turned off the main road into the heart of Sultanahmet, we couldn't help but feel excited. The cobbled streets, the groups of people conducting business or whiling away their time, the bazaars and guy selling freshly squeezed orange and pomegranate juice all indicated that we were in for a treat staying in this area. As we rounded a corner to Hotel Djem, we were heartened to discover that the hotel looked just as it did in the pictures on the internet. We were greeted warmly by the staff. Whilst Farouk, the lovely owner filled out the relevant forms, we were given delicious cups of Turkish tea and some very tasty delicacies. We felt very welcome and could hardly wait to see our room. On entering, it was a thumbs up - very tastefully decorated with lovely finishings (again, just like the pictures on the web). The bathroom had plenty of toiletries and we were pleasantly surprised to find things like mini vanity kits provided for us. We were given slippers, good quality towels and the beds were roomy and very comfortable. The staff were amazing - we grew to love Farouk and Shahin who always had some advice about where to go, what to do and did everything they could to make our stay comfortable. Breakfast was very tasty - boiled eggs (scrambled available on request), cut meats, a variety of breads and spreads and delicacies to go with your coffee - in a word, yum! The location was amazing, literally a couple of minutes walk from the Blue Mosque and the other sights of Sultanahmet. We very much enjoyed our stay at Hotel Djem and we really hope to return in the not so distant future. Book without hesitation, you will NOT regret it :o).

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location and service”
Reviews.Author: jesko
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights at Hotel Djem, which we found on Tripadvisor. Its just around the corner from the Hippodrome to the south of the Blue Mosque. We had booked a standard room, but Faruk who owns Hotel Djem, upgraded us to the top floor deluxe room without our asking for the same price. This was just the beginning of what turned out to be just a wonderful experience in Istanbul. The room was in the â€œannex,â€� just about 50 meters away from the main building/reception area. Both are located on a cobblestone street, lined with a few shops and a restaurant. Quiet at night, with a steady but not overbearing flow of tourists during the day. The room like the entryway and the main building was beautifully appointed with furniture, rugs and antiquities collected by Faruk and his family. Each item worth your attention. Room was large, with a bank of windows, well air conditioned, and clean. Bathroom simple, could use a bit more shelf space, but fully stocked with supplies. Breakfasts were terrific, from fresh tomatoes, cucumbers, cheese, and fresh fruit to freshly prepared eggs and muesli. And of course olives. Try the preserves, especially the cherry. Fresh rolls and bread. And check out the old maps on the walls. But the best part of Hotel Djem is the attention that Faruk paid to each of his guests. In sequence, he would come over to each of out tables in the morning, talk about the events of the previous day, then help plan out the next day. Just tell him what you are interested in doing, and he will help design an itinerary. His suggestions for restaurants were consistently accurate, and if you let him he will direct you on a journey to places that most tourists donâ€™t go and food that you might miss. I think that Turkey was one of the nicest places we have traveled. Everyone was so engaging and helpful. Just make sure you say merhaba and teÅŸekÃ¼r and be respectful of the different customs in this wonderful country.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: SSo03-13-08-2011
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 10 days trip to Istanbul where we stayed at the cozy Djem Hotel. The hotel is located very close to the blue mosque and within 5 mns walk to Sultanahmet tramway station which is ideal to visit the old part of Istanbul and, after a tramway trip or a ferry, other parts of the city. The rooms are comfortable, quiet, very clean and nicely decorated. The wireless internet connection works fine and was very convenient. A special mention for the nice breakfast with a variety of fresh fruits, dairy and pastry that made it a treat every day. But most of all, the quality of the service and the availability of the personal is what made our stay so pleasant. They provided us with valuable tips to visit the city and, when we had some (minor) requests (e.g. a second access card to the rooms, â€¦), the general manager just replied: weâ€™ll take care of it and then he didâ€¦ Istanbul is a great city and we enjoyed all 10 days of our stay. We hope to be able to visit again and if we do, weâ€™ll definitely stay in the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “a home away from home”
Reviews.Author: nanasaheb
Reviews.Content: The Djem is a high quality establishment and a friendly haven in Istanbul staffed with wonderful people in a unbeatable location. Location -- The hotel shares its boundary wall with the south western wall of the Blue Mosque. From some of the rooms you get a direct view of the Blue Mosque. It is on a relatively quiet street in Sultanhamet, compared to other streets like Akibiyik Caddessi (which has most of the hotels ) which serves as the tourist ghetto of Sultanhamet. If you have to stay in Sultanhamet -- this hotel is in a very good and convenient location. With a taxi it will cost you about 35-40 lira from the airport. You can also reach the hotel using the railway + tram ( 1.75 + 1.75 lira take the train from the airport level 0, get down at Zeytinburnu, change to the tram station use the Kabatas line and get down at Sultanhamet) alternatively if you are light on luggage you can also reach using just the railway (1.75 lira - take the train from the airport level 0, get down at Cankurtaran, from there the hotel is a 500 metre walk ). Layout -- The main rooms of the hotel are spread across 2 different buildings close to each other. The buildings are former houses which have been turned into a hotel, which adds to the charm of the place. This also means you will not find the typical things you expect in hotels built from the ground up -- like elevators or swimming pools or concierges in uniform opening the door for you. Rooms -- I stayed at the Djem for 5 nights. During my stay I stayed in different rooms. Room 10 has a great view of the blue mosque, Room 1 is on the ground floor and apart from the view it is equally good. The rooms themselves range from compact to fairly large, but they are all impeccably clean and functional. The quality of the furnishings show a lot of thought and taste. The rooms are quiet and provide for very good sleep quality. The bathrooms are all excellently functional custom built units some rooms have a bathtub - others have a shower box. Note that even though the Blue Mosque is right next door -- I did not find the muezzin calls to be a disturbance -- there is a difference between sound and noise, and the muezzin call is part of the ambient sound in Istanbul, it is not loud enough to be called noise. Staff -- The hotel is a complete winner on this count. Starting with Farouk the general manager to Ismael the guy who is most often at the front desk. I have stayed in many hotels where the staff can be impersonal, but these two gentlemen exude genuine friendliness and concern about your well being. They are extremely knowledgable about Istanbul, where to go, what to eat, the history of the place etc. It is a real pleasure and privilege to meet such people. Breakfast -- The breakfast focuses on quality rather than quantity. There is excellent turkish tea, and well made coffee. There is an assortment of tasty fresh fruits (watermelon, kiwi and pineapples), olives, marmalades, cheeses and cold-cuts. Best of all is the cold yogurt which makes a good combo with the marmalades. There is also a selection of breads and pastries. Internet -- fast and free wifi internet in all the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable Stay!”
Reviews.Author: scarletlettera
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a return trip for 2 nights. Room was spacious and clean and comfortable. Boutique hotel is well located for seeing the major sites. The owner was friendly and extremely knowledgeable about local places to visit and restaurants to try. The breakfasts were expansive and filling. Loved the different local pastries. Would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “the jazz and the tradition”
Reviews.Author: Tuskerine
Reviews.Content: I was in Istanbul for the jazz festival - the Djem is like a family home,once you are there, you might as well just hang around, read a book or watch a film, coz it is so relaxing - nevertheless Istanbul is just outside the door and you don;t want to miss it, but once you ar tired from running around, you feel so good about coming back home to the Djem, and you can be sure the staff asks you about your adventures and gives hints, once they know what you like - but they also let you rest, just in case you feel like enjoying your incredible room behind the blue mosque and wish to meditate on the calls for prayers ... you can not not love Djem, would not know how,with even the night-guard having an art history background ,,, I came back late in the mornings and it was all cool, Even the stray cats get something to eat (but in my opinion could be more). all in all -I would not know a better place.

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of history”
Reviews.Author: TorkelKarlsbad
Reviews.Content: We were welcomed late in afternoon and were met with very kind and pleasant service and a cup of tea and some nice good cakes, so the start couldn't be better. We also got a good deal of useful information at the same time. Our room was in the upper floor, every room had its personal design in nice Turkish design and to my great delight we could lie in the bed and look through the windowcurtains at the bronzepillar in the Hippodrome. The room was rather spacious with enough place to keep our things and a safe for the valuables. The bathroom had all you could expect and we were provided with bathrobes. We also had our heavy suitecase carried up to the room. Breakfast was good and was very fresh and delicate with quite a lot to choose from. Visiting Istanbul Djem hotel has the most perfect location for sightseeing placed just behind the Hippodrome and the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia a few steps away as well as a lot of other interesting sites. It will be a pleasure to return hera another time in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, stylish and cozy”
Reviews.Author: dkalid64
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for four nights and absolutely loved it. The location couldn't be better -- adjacent to the Blue Mosque and the Arasta Bazaar and within 5 - 10 minutes walk to every site in Sultanahmet. We also had no problem getting to the tram lines from here when we wanted to venture a little further out. The staff were lovely and they gave good advice about siteseeing as well as more practical matters like finding an open pharmacy on a Sunday. We loved the place so much we even added a day on to our stay there, which they accommodated, no problem. The furniture and artwork throughout the hotel are just beautiful and the owner also has a shop in the bazaar, with dangerously nice things. Nice breakfast with much better American-style coffee than we found at most hotels in Turkey. (A warning to vegans who travel to Turkey -- bring soy milk packets and peanut butter!! We couldn't find either anywhere in the whole country, and no matter how fresh the produce might be, you can only take dry bread, cucumbers and tomatoes for breakfast for so many days...)

Reviews.Title: “Friendly attentive service”
Reviews.Author: GJDBalmain
Reviews.Content: We were unlucky as we didn't realize the room we had booked over the net was some 10 min walk from the hotel. So we got off on the wrong foot with the manager, however when we sorted that out the "apart-suite" was ok. The staff were friendly and helpful, breakfast was good. TV didn't work in the room. The room was on the first floor and quiet. The price was $200 a night. We have moved since more central hotel at $134 per night with a roof top views of the city which Djem does not have.

Reviews.Title: “Everything just right”
Reviews.Author: Winetraveller_7
Reviews.Content: Djem is a little B&B in a renovated Ottoman house, everything is new--the rooms are clean, the bathrooms have new fixtures, the breakfast is great with lots of selections. The staff is friendly and very helpful. Location is a block from the hippodrome, close to everything, tram is only 2 blocks away. We were very pleased with our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “As advertized - great service, great location, Great People”
Reviews.Author: leeaf
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in Istanbul from April 11 to April 29, with a 4 day trip to Cappidocia in the middle. Due to heavy demand a room in the Hotel was not available for our entire stay, so we were offered a room in their Apart Hotel nearby. We were completely satisfied. It was a brisk 5 minute walk or a 10 minute stroll away from the hotel. Easy walk. We ate breakfast at the Hotel each morning. Our plan is usually to have a heavy breakfast and either a mid afternoon snack and a restaurant supper or a heavy afternoon meal followed by a snack in the evening. Djem breakfast accomodated that strategy. I usually had two eggs- scrambled, fried, boiled or an omelet, whatever requested. Then toast with jam and butter, cereal with milk and strawberries and pomegranite seeds added in. Coffee or tea, and a choice of pomegranite, apple or orange juice. Then a few tablespoons of a variety of olives. Then several quartered tomatoes plus cucumbers. That usually did it for me although cold cuts and a variety of cheeses were available. The room in the apart hotel were tastefully decorated and furnished with what is needed for a family in an apartment- small refrigerator, microwave, knives, forks, spoons, plates, glasses, mugs, bowls, scissors, corkscrew, hair blowdryer, you get the idea. One queensized bed and two regular sized beds. A small table with 4 chairs, a sitting area with 3 chairs. A large closet, ample drawer space to unload your luggage. Then the service: Matin reserved two tickets on the train from Istanbul to Urgup in Cappadocia. He waited until the tickets were discounted. Roundtrip tickets in our private sleeper compartment for two coming and going to Urgup cost about 210 turkish lira, about $140 total for two nights lodging and the trip. Daily recommendations regarding everything from restaurant recommendations to directions to everywhere. I guess, if I were picky, I could find things to complain about during such a long stay, but I just don't feel like doing it considering how much I liked the people at Djem. I would stay there again without question. For a first time stay in a big city like Istanbul you can't beat Djem.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Djem was a home away from home”
Reviews.Author: suitcaseguy
Reviews.Content: My six nights long stay at the Djem Boutique Hotel in Istanbul was wonderful. As a rather experienced traveller I must admit this was one of the better (in its category) and memorable hotels I have stayed in. It had a very warm personal touch to it starting with the welcome tea and sweets served to the goodbye waves while leaving the hotel by Metin. Special thanks goes to Metin, Shahin and Mr. Faruq (proprietor). Although I was rather well prepared for Istanbul as far as sights were concerned I received many local travel tips from the aforementioned trio. The room was well appointed and tasteful decor with a nice colour scheme, though not too big and very clean as was the bathroom. Bathroom amenities were adequate but basic. Breakfast was more than adequate and nicely laid out. The surroundings of the hotel were picturesque and peaceful and it was always nice to return after a day out in the teeming city. The Blue Mosque is right next door but the call to prayers were not disturbing at all. Other sights in the vicinity are the Hagia Sophia, Meydani, Grand Bazaar and Top Kapi. The tram stop is a 5 minute walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Wano_BGA
Reviews.Content: The title says it all - it is the best place to explore Istanbul, especially if you are in the city for the first time. The location just couldn't be better - right in the middle of Sultanahmet, 5 minutes walk to all the major attractions. We stayed in room â„–10 and when we opened the curtains, we saw Blue Mosque just behind the wall, the hotel is right next to it. The city was so beautiful in the evening. Hotel manager - Metin - is especially friendly and helpful (people in Istanbul are willing to help you, but he was more than that), he helped us plan the itinerary for the 3 days we spent there and also allowed us to have a late check-out as there were no bookings for the next day. The only drawback was the breakfast - it was OK, but didn't vary from day to day, but it is good it was like that as you can go and have some delicious food in enormous amount of cafes and restaurants in the neighborhood. Also, don't forget to print the map from the hotel's website, even with it taxi driver can take up to 3 rounds around the area to locate the hotel (the name of the hotel is pronounced di-jem, this way they understand it better). The stay here was an unforgettable experience in a beautiful historical city, I recommend everyone to spend some time there.

Reviews.Title: “There is no lift and the hotel is dark form inside”
Reviews.Author: honestha
Reviews.Content: I love the cleanliness of the room, bathroom and the breakfast was good. Staff was very helpful too. No emergency exit and fire escape.!!

Reviews.Title: “A gem with helpful staff and cosy roms”
Reviews.Author: DavidEriksson
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner went from Sweden to Istanbul to get our eyes operated and chose this hotel based on the reviews on the Internet. After staying 4 nights in a superior double room at this hotel. I can only agree with the reviews. The room were clean and cosy. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. The location was also excellent and the price was extremely low. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Istanbul. An extra plus is that the personell saved the life of a wild kitten during our visit with temporary food and shelter during the snowing days(!). Skip the anonymous hotel chains and get a room at this soulful hotel instead.

Reviews.Title: “STAY HERE!!”
Reviews.Author: OneLandshark
Reviews.Content: Hotel Djem is a nice Boutique Hotel located near the historic center of Istanbul. The moment I arrived their staff were immediately accommodating. They cared about our stay here. they made suggestions about restaurants and local sites.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: patrickandlucy
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable and welcoming atmosphere, great staff and excellent breakfast. Staff, especially Mehten went out there way to help and truely understood what we wanted and were able to provide honest comment on what we wanted to do, where to go and where not to go and what to ask for from sight seeing to food to hammam to travel. If ever back in Istanbul would return without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Special, clean, friendly: in a perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: bobojkb
Reviews.Content: After arriving late in the morning (airport pick-up arranged by hotel), staff put out wonderful "breakfast" for us to fuel our sleepy exploration of Istanbul. Our triple room was a short half block away from main hotel. This ended up being just fine. Accommodations were clean, seemed newly remodeled, with a high-ceilinged old world charm . Easy walking distance to mosques and old city sites. The staff was very helpful and friendly. To quote one young man we had a lively discussion with, "This is not just a job to me, this is my family".

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Trickey-Dickey
Reviews.Content: Why would anyone want to spend lots of money at a large expensive city hotel wÄ±th a big unfriendly foyer, when you can stay at this superb boutique style small hotel that has everything! From the first frÄ±endly welcome by Metin, the ultra efficient front of house manager, to the warm daily smÄ±les from the breakfast team and cleanÄ±ng staff, this place has to be a top pick for service levels. And it is location, location, location. Everything important is just a stroll away. Also take MetinÂ´s advÄ±ce and take a trÄ±p to hÄ±s recommended Hamman it is worth every Kurus! I havenÂ´t added any photos of the place as everythÄ±ng on their web site is genuine.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, and well situated. They aim to please.”
Reviews.Author: xdisney
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived and were welcomed to breakfast (nice, lots of yummy pastries, fruits, cereal, and eggs any style), we felt at home. Owner made a point to spend time and show us on a map where all the sights were, and to tend to our needs. This attitude was echoed by the entire staff. Location is perfect, a few minutes walk from Ayasophia and all the other Sultanmet sights, as well as the tram which takes you all over, but yet it is situatel in a funky, charming little local neighborhood. We were somewhat taken aback when we found that our room was in an annex a few doors down, but it tuenrs out that that was not an issue at all. Decor is tasteful and classy. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Djem is a true gem!”
Reviews.Author: Glup44
Reviews.Content: This is a most delightful hotel. Rooms are small but immaculately clean and tastefully decorated in true Turkish style. Our host, the charming Mr. Faruk, picked us up and returned us to the airport, and, along with his gracious staff, catered to our every need. The breakfasts were bountiful and delicious, and if you go, be sure to ask Mr. Faruk for a fried egg -- the best fried egg ever! The location of the hotel is perfect, in the heart of the Sultanahmet, with the Blue Mosque literally steps away, and the Hagia Sofia, Hippodrome, and Grand Bazaar only a few minutes' walk. You cannot go wrong with the Hotel Djem!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Djem - the best”
Reviews.Author: rakub
Reviews.Content: Great location, nice rooms, perfect staff, delicious breakfest, ... 100 %!:)

Reviews.Title: “best customer service I've ever had”
Reviews.Author: severens
Reviews.Content: Through my job, I've been lucky enough to stay in some of the world's best hotels. But I have never had the kind of customer service we received at Hotel Djem. They went out of their way to assist us with every request (always exceeding our expectations). And they treated us as if we were treasured guests in their home - not simply as clients. The location is ideal - 2 minutes walk from the Blue Mosque in an adorable neighborhood of cobblestone streets. The rooms are carefully decorated with hand-picked pieces of art and weavings. Breakfasts include a delicious mix of fresh local fruits, vegetables, and baked goods.

Reviews.Title: “Start your Istanbul adventure here!”
Reviews.Author: dinka3
Reviews.Content: After your long flight to the fabulous city of Istanbul, what do you need? An intimate, spotless, comfortable, aesthetically pleasing small hotel with a terrific staff. Seriously. There are lots of hotels, pensions, and b&b's in the Sultanahmet area, but you will be so glad you picked Hotel Djem. Farouk will take of your every need, answer questions, and do so as if it's his sole purpose to please you. Wonderful breakfast is included...everything fresh and delicious. Good air conditioning, ( really appreciated in the hot humid weather), bathtubs...all is modern yet cozy. Around the corner is the Blue Mosque, Sultanahmet Park, and within short walking distance are Haga Sofya, Basilica Cistern, and Topkapi Palace...not to mention the tram, plenty of restaurants and the Grand Bazaar....Don't miss the Arasta Bazaar behind the Blue Mosque for a more low-key, quality shopping experience after the mother of all shopping destinations, the Grand Bazaar. Honestly, don't mess around with more expensive hotels...this is all you need and you will feel like a Sultan....well, almost!

Reviews.Title: “Felt like Nicest Guest Room at Your Friend's Place”
Reviews.Author: LilyChina
Reviews.Content: Hotel Djem made our trip to Istanbul extremely comfortable and warm, like staying at a friend's house in their nicest room. Location was perfect to be close to the sights without being in the middle of the tourist traffic. The breakfasts are QUALITY over quantity, with the selection of fresh local and regional fruits, cheeses, pastries, olives, eggs, tomatoes and cucumbers plenty to fill anyone's stomach. Rooms are comfortable and tasteful, understated without being sparse; bathroom is functional and small. The only thing that some people may not find perfect are that there are stairs involved to get to your room and the earliest prayer call of 5 daily from the Blue Mosque is at 4:30 a.m. - I didn't mind either! Both the owners and the staff are sincere, hospitable and seem to love people. Their recommendations on what to see and where to go/eat are spot on. THANK YOU DJEM for a wonderful stay and even better memories.

Reviews.Title: “hidden jewel in the heart of sultanameth”
Reviews.Author: soniadi
Reviews.Content: As soon as you walk into this boutique hotel , you know you've made the right choice .We enjoyed everything of our stay : the welcoming smile of Mety , always available for sincere information and tips, the nicely decorated rooms with all comforts without any obsolete excess, the abundant breakfast table , the incredible quietness of the road , the calls of the muezin from the nearby blue Mosque , the proximity of cultural sites . When we met the owner, Mr Farouk, we understood why this boutique hotel had such a personal touch- and approach . Every morning Mr Farouk met his guests and took the time to exchange views , dreams, and more . He always had a nice thought for each of us : a turskish coffee, a tchai . Our flight back to Italy was late , and he let us stay in the room long after checking out time . He is what we in italian would say " un signore "- and the hotel a real "hidden jewel in the heart of Sultanameth"

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Djem
HotelInfo.Address: Tavukhane sok 30 | sultanahmet, Istanbul 34420, Turkey
